text:
The hearings this week have done nothing to alleviate the concerns raised about why this nominee was chosen and why this process is being rushed.

My Republican colleagues are doing great harm with this illegitimate process, and great damage to the people and the Supreme Court.

I asked Judge Barrett if she agreed with this quote by Chief Justice Roberts: “Voting discrimination still exists. No one doubts that.”

She wouldn’t say. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkUjDcrWkAAPgFz.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1316496457189470208/vid/320x320/bo6Fz9jon1YO5x9p.mp4?tag=13

Tune in here for my final round of questions with Trump’s Supreme Court nominee. There is so much at stake with who fills this seat, including health care protections for more than 100 million Americans with preexisting conditions. https://www.pscp.tv/w/clYE9zF4ZUtXUHlHbFBlalB8MU9kSnJXQnF6eWt4WJJUeZu31QVQKIDhsQOGcKh6wy-2ICj-0KaME7AJxKEl

This year's wildfire season has been devastating and California is still not in the clear. With another heat wave and strong winds impacting the state this week, please stay safe, listen to local officials, and take care of each other.

Let’s not pretend that we don’t know how this nominee views the Affordable Care Act or a woman’s right to choose. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkTklcOWAAAgCib.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1316426720501792775/vid/320x320/pVCaKTYwDLoLlpa-.mp4?tag=13

Nothing about this is right.

Nothing about this is just. 

We’re in the middle of an election where millions of Americans have already voted for president—and that president should nominate our country’s next Supreme Court Justice.

Disney’s own short-sightedness left the company in a cash bind during COVID-19. I want to know how Disney’s financial choices impacted its decision to lay off workers, and if Disney will extend health care or other critical benefits and protections for laid off employees.

For years, Disney invested big-time in stock buybacks to pump up stock prices and dividend payments for wealthy shareholders. And just weeks before the devastating layoffs, Disney decided its executives had sacrificed enough for COVID-19 and restored their over-the-top salaries.

When Disney announced it was laying off 28,000 workers, it blamed CA for closing parks during a pandemic. But Disney didn't mention how it had deflated its financial cushion by paying out billions to rich shareholders and executives. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-warren-walt-disney-letter-idUSKBN26Z1JB

Let’s be clear: Donald Trump made a promise in 2016 to let far-right, pro-corporate groups like the Federalist Society hand-pick his shortlist for the Supreme Court. Trump kept that promise by picking Amy Coney Barrett. https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2019/investigations/leonard-leo-federalists-society-courts/

.@SenWhitehouse is right: the Supreme Court isn't subject to the same ethics rules as other federal judges. My bill to #EndCorruptionNow would close this absurd loophole, ban judges from taking gifts from private individuals or corporations, and boost transparency of our courts.

This will leave low-income people, people of color, and rural communities uncounted, underfunded, and under-represented for the next decade. 

And that’s exactly what the Trump administration wants. https://twitter.com/voxdotcom/status/1316139170931396608 QT @voxdotcom BREAKING: The Supreme Court just let the Trump administration shut down the census early.

People are scared. They’re scared what will happen if the Supreme Court destroys the Affordable Care Act in the middle of a pandemic. They're scared what Amy Coney Barrett's nomination means for Roe v. Wade.

I’m talking about all this and more on @maddow at 9pm ET tonight.

Chief Justice John Roberts said in Shelby County v. Holder that no one doubts discrimination in voting still exists. I asked Judge Barrett whether she agreed with that statement or not. 

She refused to comment.
